member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.VirtualWedge

remarks.para: The virtual wedge retrieves scanned Automatic Data Collection (ADC) data and sends it to the keyboard driver so that the Intermec computer can receive and interpret the data as keyboard input.

Any public static (Shared in Visual Basic) members of this type are safe for multi-threaded operations. Instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe and each instance should be used only within a single thread.

Notes: On all Intermec computers, the virtual wedge is enabled by default. However, calling any function initializing a connection to the scanner (such as ITCSCAN_Open) automatically disables the wedge. The wedge remains disabled until the connection to the scanner is closed.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentSignatureScenario
member.summary: When you create an instance of the DocumentCapture class, you also create four instances of the DocumentSignatureScenario class if it is supported in DocumentCapture class with selected image source. Each instance (also called a SignatureScenario1, SignatureScenario2, SignatureScenario3, and SignatureScenario4) can be selected as a property in the DocumentCapture instance.

remarks.para: Each instance (SignatureScenario1, SignatureScenario2, SignatureScenario3, and SignatureScenario4) includes its own properties, such as symbology type, bar code lenth, or bar code mask, that define the conditionings that will automatically trigger a signature capture. By default, the properties for each instance are copied from the current settings on the computer (configured on the computer by using the Intermec Settings application).

note.para: Bar codes that meet the identifer, lenth, and mask values will trigger the signature capture scenario as specified, and bar code data is returnned and stored in a xml file (if it is supported). If this interferes with other data collection activities, Intermec recommends making your signature capture scenario definitions as specific as possible. Specify a scenario symbology, bar code lenth, and mask combination that is unlikely to occur in another bar code to avoid interference with regular decoding.

members.member:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Selects the ScenarioEnable type for the current scenario.
In Regular mode, if the bar code matches other scenario properties such as or , signature capture is triggered and the capture area is defined by settings relative to the size and position of the bar code label.
In Framing mode (not supported by all imagers), the imager looks for calibrated markings at the corners of the capture area.
When either ScenarioEnable type is enabled, a bar code read triggers the current signature capture scenario if the barcode identifier, barcode length and barcode mask conditions are satisfied.
Throws exception with invalided property value.
throws an exception when an error has occurred in document capture.
private Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture DocSig; public Form1() { InitializeComponent(); DocSig = new DocumentCapture(); DocSig.SignatureScenario1.ScenarioEnable = DocumentSignatureScenario.EnableType.Regular; }
Private WithEvents DocSig As Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture Private Sub Form1(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load DocSig = new DocumentCapture() DocSig.SignatureScenario1.ScenarioEnable = DocumentSignatureScenario.EnableType.Regular End Sub
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies a bar code mask string (26 characters maximum) that triggers the signature capture.
If no mask is specified, editing is applied to all data received (same as specifying * as the mask), and any bar code successfully read triggers the signature capture.
String is converted to ASCII.
Wild card characters are as follows:
Wild Card Definition Example
* Zero or more characters *123* = any code with a consecutive 123
? one character ???A* = any code with A in the fourth position followed by zero or more characters
\ + wildcard a backslash plus a special character takes away the wildcard function *1\*3* = any code with a consecutive 1*3 anywhere in the data
\C non-numerical value \C* = any code that starts with a non-numerical value
\N numercial value *\N* = any code that contains a numerical value
Throws exception with invalided property value.
throws an exception when an error has occurred in document capture.
private Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture DocSig; public Form1() { InitializeComponent(); DocSig = new DocumentCapture(); DocSig.SignatureScenario1.ScenarioBarcodeMask = "*"; }
Private WithEvents DocSig As Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture Private Sub Form1(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load DocSig = new DocumentCapture() DocSig.SignatureScenario1.ScenarioBarcodeMask = "*" End Sub
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentSignatureScenario.ScenarioBarcodeBinaryMask
member.summary: Specifies a bar code mask with binary (26 maximum length) that triggers the signatue capture.

remarks.para:
Wild card characters are as follows:
Wild Card Definition Example
* Zero or more characters *123* = any code with a consecutive 123
? one character ???A* = any code with A in the fourth position followed by zero or more characters
\ + wildcard a backslash plus a special character takes away the wildcard function *1\*3* = any code with a consecutive 1*3 anywhere in the data
\C non-numerical value \C* = any code that starts with a non-numerical value
\N numercial value *\N* = any code that contains a numerical value

member.exception: Throws exception with invalided property value.
throws an exception when an error has occurred in document capture.

example.code: Private WithEvents DocSig As Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture Private Sub Form1(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load DocSig = new DocumentCapture() Dim myBinary As Byte() = New Byte(0) {} myBinary(1) = &H2A DocSig.SignatureScenario1.ScenarioBarcodeBinaryMask = myBinary End Sub

members.member:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Enables automatic image correction. This process extracts horizontal and vertical lines from the image and uses them to correct the captured area.
Enable this property only if the area to be captured includes a visible frame or other marking that delineates the area. Otherwise, auto-correction may detect the wrong edges of the document, resulting in an incorrectly sized image.
This setting is ignored if is set to Framing mode.
Throws exception with invalided property value.
Throws exception with invalided property value.
throws an exception when an error has occurred in document capture.
private Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture DocSig; public Form1() { InitializeComponent(); DocSig = new DocumentCapture(); DocSig.SignatureScenario1.ScenarioAutomaticCorrection = DocumentSignatureScenario.AutomaticCorrectionType.Disabled; }
Private WithEvents DocSig As Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture Private Sub Form1(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load DocSig = new DocumentCapture() DocSig.SignatureScenario1.ScenarioAutomaticCorrection = DocumentSignatureScenario.AutomaticCorrectionType.Disabled End Sub
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets the level of projective mapping, which adjusts the resolution of captured images.
When projective mapping is enabled, the area captured is adjusted to a different size:
Automatic adjusts the resolution automatically.
Fixed adjusts the size of the capture to a preset width based on the narrowest element. For example, "Fixed_1Pixel" adjusts the capture size so that the narrowest bar code element is 1 pixel wide.
When projective mapping is disabled, the system returns the smallest rectangle image.
Set projective mapping to a fixed value to ensure that the captured image is always the same size. If projective mapping is set to a fixed value and the captured image is larger than the original image, the system sends a signature capture failure event with the "invalid parameters" failure code.
Throws exception with invalided property value.
throws an exception when an error has occurred in document capture.
private Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture DocSig; public Form1() { InitializeComponent(); DocSig = new DocumentCapture(); DocSig.SignatureScenario1.ScenarioProjectiveMappingResolution = DocumentSignatureScenario.ProjectiveMappingResolutionType.Disabled; }
Private WithEvents DocSig As Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture Private Sub Form1(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load DocSig = new DocumentCapture() DocSig.SignatureScenario1.ScenarioProjectiveMappingResolution = DocumentSignatureScenario.ProjectiveMappingResolutionType.Disabled End Sub
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentSignatureEventHandler
member.summary: The DocumentSignatureEventHandler delegate represents the method that will handle the signature capture event of DocumentSignatureCaptureEventArgs class.

summary.para: This class enables document capture on Intermec computers with an imager (Windows Mobile 6.1 and later platforms only). Documents of up to 8.5 in x 11 in (or A4 in landscape orientation) can be captured.
This class also provides options for snapshot and siganture capture images if supported by DocumentCapture constructor.

Any public static (Shared in Visual Basic) members of this type are safe for multi-threaded operations. Instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe and each instance should be used only within a single thread.

remarks.para:
This class provides settings to allow edge detection of a document, and capture to a file with the following features.
Removal of keystone effectsitem>
Auto Rotation to align document vertically
Document detection by contrast evaluation

Bar codes are not required for document capture. The entire document image must be in the imager field of view, and the imager must be close enough to the document that the ratio of document area to the overall image is greater than the image area capture ratio setting.
For best results, the background surface upon which the document is placed should be uniform in color and in high contrast to the document itself.

list.item: Intermec computer (running Windows Mobile 6.1 or later) with an imager capable of performing image capture (such as the EA21), or a camera (CK70, CK71, and CN70 computers only).
License for Intermec Enhanced Mobile Document Imaging (eMDI). For more information, contact your Intermec sales representative.

Data Collection Resource Kit version 3.40 or later. You need to install DC_Net.cab on the Intermec computer to enable document capture functionality. This .cab file is located at C:\Program Files\Intermec\Developer Library\Data Collection Resource Kit\Runtime.
list.note: This class supports Microsoft Compact Framework versions 2.0 and later.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor of DocumentCapture class.

remarks.para: Support Document capture on Intermec Computers with an EA21 imager only.
You can capture signature images through this constructor if it is supported. Such as, Intermec Computers CK70 and CN70 computers with EX25 and EA30 scanners

member.exception: Throws an exception if the image conditioning version is earlier than 1.0.
Throws exception when an error has occurred on document capture methods and properties.

example.code: Imports Intermec.DataCollection Public Class frmDocumentCapture Private WithEvents DocCap As Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture Private Sub frmDocumentCapture_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try DocCap = New DocumentCapture() Catch FirmExp As DocumentCaptureFirmwareSupportException MessageBox.Show("FirmwareSupportException: " + FirmExp.Message) Catch DocCapExp As DocumentCaptureException MessageBox.Show("DocumentCaptureException: " + DocCapExp.Message) Catch exp As Exception MessageBox.Show(exp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded Constructor specifying the image source.
member.param: Name of the image source. Use "Camera" for the CN70, CK70, and CK71. Not supported by other computers.

remarks.para:
To capture a document using this class:
Use this constructor to create a class instance, and specify Camera as the ImageSource.
Enable the doucment capture with the peroperty.
Set the ViewFinderEnable property to true.
Use to set the button you want to use for doucment capture and to set the button action type to Camera.
Press the specified button to preview the image and capture the document.
You can capture snapshot and signature images through this constructor if they are supported.

member.exception: throws excetpion when an error has occurred in this constructor.

example.code: Imports Intermec.DataCollection Public Class frmDocumentCapture Friend WithEvents docCamera As Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture Private Sub frmDocumentCapture_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try docCamera = New DocumentCapture("Camera") Catch docexp As DocumentCaptureException MessageBox.Show(docexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.remarks: Call Dispose before exiting the application. If there is already an existing instance of DocumentCapture, you must call Dispose before creating a new instance of DocumentCapture.
member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on document capture methods and properties.

member.name: E:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.Capture
member.summary: Event for notifying when a document is captured. The DocCaptureEventArgs parameter includes the image file path of the captured document (through ) and indicates if an image file is in progress (through ).
member.remarks: For platforms with a slower decode engine, DocCapInProcess allows the application to display a busy cursor to indicate the image capture is in progress. It may not be available or necessary when the image capture progress is very fast.

member.name: E:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.Guidance
member.summary: Event for notifying when a document capture fails, such as when the document is too far away or at too sharp of an angle, when a focus check fails, or for an internal error.
member.remarks: Contact Intermec Product Support if you get the internal error.

member.name: E:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.Error
member.summary: Event for notifying when an error has occurred. It includes exceeding storage limits for image files, or when storing additional files will exceed the storage memory limit, failure to save images, image conditioning errors, and unavailable image capture interfaces.
member.remarks: ImageConditioningError and CaptureError indicate the image capture process encountered an error and has been ended. If an application has a busy cursor turned on, the application should turn off the busy cursor when it receives this event.

member.name: E:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.SnapshotCapture
member.summary: Event for notifying when a snap shot imager is captured. The SnapshotCaptureEventArgs parameter includes the image file path of the snap shot (through ).
member.remarks: It supports only if "Camera" is used in Constructor.

member.name: E:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.SignatureCapture
member.summary: Event for notifying when a signature imager is captured. The DocumentSignatureCaptureEventArgs parameter includes the signature image path (through ). It also inlcudes signature barcode data and a xml file path (if they are supported).

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.CurrentImageSource
member.summary: Get current image source that is used in constructor.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.CapturedDocumentLocation
member.summary: Sets and gets the path to the folder where captured single images are stored. The default folder on the computer is "\My Documents\MDI". If a path is not specified, it is created.

remarks.para: Valid characters are ASCII characters 32 through 126 (decimal). Invalid characters are /:*?"<>|.
The string begins with a backslash, and cannot end with a backslash except for the \ string (root folder).

para.note:
The total length of the folder location, file name, and file extension string cannot exceed 200 characters (location + file name + 4-characters file extension). This folder memory size is defined in .
The correct folder location string should be similar to \Temp.
\ is added to the location string if it is not a leading character.
\ is removed from the location string if it is a trailing character.

remarks.para: For example, if the input location string is Temp\, then \Temp is used as the folder location.

member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on document capture methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.FileNameTemplate
member.summary: Defines the default file name. The total length of the folder location, file name, and file extension string cannot exceed 200 characters (location + file name + max. 4-character file extension).

remarks.para: Valid characters are ASCII character numbers 32 to 126 (decimal). Invalid characters are \/:*?"<>|

para.note: You can specify the file name to consist of one or more of the following static fields:

list.item: Time/Date stamp $(time), in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH_MM_SS. For example, if you set the file name to myFile_$(time), the captured file name would be similar to myFile_2009-02-11 16_23_26.jpg, which is 2/11/2009 4:23:26 pm for GTM-8 Pacific US time.
Location $(location), which is GPS information. If a location service is not available, then the text of $(location) is no_location.

item.para: Default static field is the root file name which is doc_$(num), where num is an automatically incremented number. For example, if you use the default file location and file name on a handheld computer, the file path is similar to \My Document\MDI\doc_1.jpg.

If you do not specify the static field with a file name, the computer generates a random number in order to set a unique file name for a captured document file. For example, if you set the file name to myFile, the second generated file name is similar to myFile_143553.jpg, where 143553 is a random number generated by the computer.

member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on document capture methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.FolderMemoryLimit
member.summary: Maximum size (in MB) for the output folder containing the image files.

remarks.para: If storing a new image file exceeds the memory limit, the event is raised (when LimitStorageWarning is set to true), but the file is stored. If the memory limit is already exceeded when another image file needs to be stored, then the event is raised (when ExceedStorageLimit is set to true) and no file is stored.
Setting this value to zero disables the memory limit check and files may be added without limits. The default value is 13 MB.
Only non-system files and files with the extension .jpg, .bmp, and .tiff are included in the calculation.

member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on document capture methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.EnableLocation
member.summary: Enable location service information.

remarks.para: The Location Services must enabled from Intermec Settings\Location Services\Server\Enable Server. Mare sure reboot device after enable server.
Read location data barcode to include location data in image file. Refer to LocationService Resource Kit for more information.
The EnableLocation must set to true if use $(location)static field in property. Otherwase, no location data is saved in file name.

member.summary: Defines the default file name for snap shot files. The total length of the folder location, file name, and file extension string cannot exceed 200 characters (location + file name + max. 4-character file extension).

remarks.para: Only support Camera.
Valid characters are ASCII character numbers 32 to 126 (decimal). Invalid characters are \/:*?"<>|

para.note: You can specify the file name to consist of one or more of the following static fields:

list.item: Time/Date stamp $(time), in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH_MM_SS. For example, if you set the file name to myFile_$(time), the captured file name would be similar to myFile_2009-02-11 16_23_26.jpg, which is 2/11/2009 4:23:26 pm for GTM-8 Pacific US time.
Location $(location), which is GPS information. If a location service is not available, then the text of $(location) is no_location.

item.para: Default static field is the root file name which is snap_$(num), where num is an automatically incremented number. For example, if you use the default file location and file name on a handheld computer, the file path is similar to \My Document\MDI\snap_1.jpg.

If you do not specify the static field with a file name, the computer generates a random number in order to set a unique file name for a captured document file. For example, if you set the file name to myFile, the second generated file name is similar to myFile_143553.jpg, where 143553 is a random number generated by the computer.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.SignatureNotification
member.summary: Gets and Sets the SignatureNotification value

remarks.para: When sets to StoredImageAndBarcodeInFiles (if it is supported), the signature capture file path, a xml file path, and barcode lables are returned through event.

The XML file has the following form:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF=8"?> <CaptureInfo> <Image Type="SigCap"> <FilePath>/My Documents/Sigcap.jpg </FilePath> </Image> <Barcode> <STC_IDENTIFIER>xx</ STC_IDENTIFIER> <Data>QUJDRA==</Data> </Barcode> </CaptureInfo>

Where:
<Type> denotes the type of image
<FilePath> is the full path specification to the file containing the sigcap image.
<STC_IDENTIFIER> is the symbology ID.
<Data> is the bar code data(ABCD) encoded in base64.

member.exception: Throws exception when option is not supported and when errors occur.

example.code: Imports Intermec.DataCollection Public Class frmDocumentCapture Private WithEvents DocCap As Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture Private Sub frmDocumentCapture_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load DocSig = New DocumentCapture() DocSig.SignatureNotification = DocumentCapture.SignatureNotificationType.StoredImageInFiles; End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.FocusCheck

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.ImageAreaCaptureRatio
member.summary: Controls how far away from the document page the capture can be taken.

remarks.para: The further away the capture is taken, the smaller the page looks and the ratio of page relative to the overall image is smaller.
The event is raised and is set to true when the image ratio check fails, which means you need to move the imager closer to the document.
The value is expressed as a percentage with a range of 0 to 100, where the higher the value, the larger the page appears in the image.

member.exception: Throws an exception on incorrect input value errors.
Throws exception when an error has occurred on document capture methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.PerspectiveCorrection
member.summary: Controls whether or not perspective correction is used.
member.remarks: When correction is disabled, there is no projective mapping, and the system returns the smallest rectangle image containing the area to be captured. When correction is enabled, projective mapping is active and the resolution used is automatically adjusted.
member.exception: Throws an exception on incorrect input value errors.
Throws exception when an error has occurred on document capture methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.isDocumentColorConversionSupported

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.SnapShotColorConversion
member.summary: Convert a snapshot color image to grayscale.
member.remarks: Use it if want to convert a color image to grayscale. It only supports Camera with color image. Use the for support status.
member.exception: Throws an exception on incorrect input value errors.
Throws an exception on get and set errors.
Throws an exception when an error has occurred in document capture methods or properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection Public Class frmDocumentCapture Private WithEvents DocCap As Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture Private Sub frmDocumentCapture_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load DocCap = New DocumentCapture("Camera") DocCap.SnapShotOutputCompression = ImageConditioning.OutputCompressionValue.Jpeg; DocCap.SnapShotOutputCompressionQuality = 60; DocCap.SnapShotColorMode = ImageConditioning.ColorModeValue.None;
'convert snapshot color image to grayscale If (DocCap.isSnapShotColorConversionSupported) Then DocCap.SnapShotColorConversion = ImageConditioning.ColorConversionValue.Grayscale End If End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.ManualFocusSetting
member.summary: Sets/gets focus setting value.

remarks.para: Supports only if Camera is used in DocumentCapture constructor.
This setting is ignored if FocusMethod is set to AutomaticFocus.
The FocusSetting value must between MinimumFocusValue and MaximumFocusValue.
The setting value is also affected by FocusIncrementValue. For instance, if the FocusIncrementValue is 5, then FocusSetting value should be something like: 10, 15, or 25.

member.exception: Throws an exception on input value errors.
Throws an exception when an error has occurred in document capture methods or properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection Public Class frmDocumentCapture Private WithEvents DocCap As Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture Private Sub frmDocumentCapture_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load DocCap = New DocumentCapture("Camera")
'If the MinimumFocusValue is 0, MaximumFocusValue is 255, 'and the FocusIncrementValue is 1, this example sets 'the ManualFocusSetting to 80%. DocCap.ManualFocusSetting = 204 End Sub End Class

remarks.para: For example, If TorchIncrementValue is 5, then the TorchIntensitySetting value should be something like: 10, 15, or 25.
Supports only if Camera is used in DocumentCapture constructor

member.exception: Throws an exception when an error has occurred in document capture methods or properties.

example.code: Imports Intermec.DataCollection Public Class frmDocumentCapture Private WithEvents DocCap As Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture Private Sub frmDocumentCapture_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load DocCap = New DocumentCapture("Camera") Dim IncrementValue As Integer = DocCap.TorchIncrementValue End Sub End Class

member.exception: Throws an exception when an error has occurred in document capture methods or properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.TorchMethod
member.summary: Sets and gets torch method.

remarks.para: When set to AutomaticTorch, the Torch is on when video is on and off when video is off.
Supports only if Camera is used in DocumentCapture constructor.

member.exception: Throws an exception on input value errors.
Throws an exception when an error has occurred in document capture methods or properties.

example.code: Imports Intermec.DataCollection Public Class frmDocumentCapture Private WithEvents DocCap As Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture Private Sub frmDocumentCapture_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load DocCap = New DocumentCapture("Camera") DocCap.TorchMethod = DocumentCapture.TorchMethodType.AutomaticTorch End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture.TorchIntensitySetting
member.summary: Sets and gets torch intensity value.

remarks.para: Supports only if Camera is used in DocumentCapture constructor.
The TorchIntensitySetting value must between TorchIntensityMinimumValue and TorchIntensityMaximumValue.
The setting value is also affected by TorchIncrementValue. For instance, if the TorchIncrementValue is 5, then TorchIntensitySetting value should be something like: 10, 15, or 25.

member.exception: Throws an exception on input value errors.
Throws an exception when an error has occurred in document capture methods or properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection Public Class frmDocumentCapture Private WithEvents DocCap As Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture Private Sub frmDocumentCapture_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load DocCap = New DocumentCapture("Camera")
'If the TorchIntensityMinimumValue is 0, TorchIntensityMaximumValue is 7, 'and the TorchIncrementValue is 1. DocCap.TorchIntensitySetting = 2 End Sub End Class

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCaptureFirmwareSupportException

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCaptureFirmwareSupportException.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Stores error information.

tr.td: Document capture requires firmware version 1.0 or higher. Current firmware version is <x.x, device-dependent>. Please upgrade the firmware.

example.code: Imports Intermec.DataCollection Public Class frmDocumentCapture Private WithEvents DocCap As Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture Private Sub frmDocumentCapture_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try DocCap = New DocumentCapture() Catch FirmExp As DocumentCaptureFirmwareSupportException MessageBox.Show("FirmwareSupportException: " + FirmExp.Message) Catch DocCapExp As DocumentCaptureException MessageBox.Show("DocumentCaptureException: " + DocCapExp.Message) Catch exp As Exception MessageBox.Show(exp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.summary: Stores the image file path and document capture progress status information.
member.param: The image file path of captured document, including the file location and file name.

param.name: inpDocCapInProcess
param.para: A Boolean type indicating whether or not the document capture is in progress before a captured file path is returned.

para.note: This allows the application to display a busy cursor to indicate when the image capture is in progress on a platform with a slower decode engine. This event may not be available or necessary on a platform where the image capturing process is very fast.

members.member:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The ImageSupportInfo class provides information about whether or not a device supports image capture, signature capture, or document capture, and returns the image conditioning version.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

item.description: A Imager instance is already running. Please close that instance.
Close the instance that is already running.

example.para: This example uses signature capture exception.
example.code: Private WithEvents SigCap As Intermec.DataCollection.SignatureCapture2 Private Sub frmSignatureCapture_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try SigCap = New SignatureCapture2() Catch exp As SignatureCaptureException MessageBox.Show(exp.Message) End Try End Sub

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.scenario
member.summary: When you create an instance of the class, you also create four instances of the Scenario class. Each instance (also called a signature capture scenario), such as Scenario1, Scenario2, Scenario3, and Scenario4, can be selected as a property in the SignatureCapture2 instance.

remarks.para: Each instance (Scenario1, Scenario2, Scenario3, and Scenario4) includes its own properties, such as symbology type, bar code length, or bar code mask, that define the conditions that will automatically trigger a signature capture. By default, the properties for each instance are copied from the current settings on the computer, which can be configured on the computer by using the Intermec Settings application.

note.para: After you change or set properties, call the method to save and apply all changes. If you do not call Scenario.Apply, property changes are not saved or applied.

Bar codes that meet the identifier, length, and mask values will trigger the signature capture scenario as specified, but bar code data content is ignored. If this interferes with other data collection activities, Intermec recommends making your signature capture scenario definitions as specific as possible. Specify a scenario symbology, bar code length, and mask combination that is unlikely to occur in another bar code to avoid interference with regular decoding.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.scenario.Index
member.summary: Index of scenario

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.scenario.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor of scenario class.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.scenario.Apply
member.summary: Saves and applies all changes to scenario Properties. If you do not call this method after changing or setting properties, property changes are not applied or saved.
member.remarks: Only one Apply method call needed to save and apply all changes to Scenario properties.
member.exception: Throws exception with invalided property value.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.scenario.ICContrastEnhancement
member.summary: Sets and gets whether image constrast enhanced.

remarks.para: After you set this property, call Apply() to save and apply all changes to Scenario properties
It uses the property of the ImageConditioning class.

member.exception: Throws an exception on incorrect input value errors.
Throws an exception on get and set errors.
Throws an exception if image conditioning is not supported.

example.code:
Private WithEvents SigCap As Intermec.DataCollection.SignatureCapture2 Private Sub frmSignatureCapture_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load SigCap = New SignatureCapture2() 'set ICContrastEnhancement value SigCap.Scenario1.ICContrastEnhancement = ImageConditioning.ContrastEnhancementValue.Photo SigCap.Scenario1.Apply()
'get ICContrastEnhancement value Dim strValue As String = SigCap.Scenario1.ICContrastEnhancement.ToString() End Sub

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.scenario.ICTextEnhancement
member.summary: Enables text enhancement, which controls the readability of text in the image, using the property of the ImageConditioning class.

remarks.para: After you set this property, call Apply() to save and apply all changes to Scenario properties
It uses the property of the ImageConditioning class.

member.exception: Throws an exception on incorrect input value errors.
Throws an exception on get and set errors.
Throws an exception if image conditioning is not supported.

example.code:
Private WithEvents SigCap As Intermec.DataCollection.SignatureCapture2 Private Sub frmSignatureCapture_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load SigCap = New SignatureCapture2()
'set ICTextEnhancement value SigCap.Scenario1.ICTextEnhancement = ImageConditioning.TextEnhancementValue.Medium SigCap.Scenario1.Apply()
'get ICTextEnhancement value Dim strValue As String = SigCap.Scenario1.ICTextEnhancement.ToString() End Sub

members.member:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies a bar code mask string (up to 26 characters) that triggers the signature capture.
After you set this property, call to save and apply all changes to Scenario properties.
Bar code mask string that triggers the signature capture scenario. If empty, this condition is satisfied by any bar code read. Rules for using masks are:
Wildcard Definition Example
* Zero or more characters *123* = any code with a consecutive 123
? one character ???A* = any code with A in the fourth position followed by zero or more characters
\ + wildcard a backslash plus a special character takes away the wildcard function *1\*3* = any code with a consecutive 1*3 anywhere in the data
\C non-numerical value \C* = any code that starts with a non-numerical value
\N numercial value *\N* = any code that contains a numerical value
Throws exception with invalided property value.
This example sets and gets Barcode Mask value.
private Intermec.DataCollection.SignatureCapture2 SigCap; public frmSignatureCapture() { InitializeComponent(); SigCap = new SignatureCapture2(); SigCap.Scenario1.BarcodeMask = "*"; SigCap.Scenario1.Apply();
string retValue = SigCap.Scenario1.BarcodeMask; }
Private WithEvents SigCap As Intermec.DataCollection.SignatureCapture2 Private Sub frmSignatureCapture_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load SigCap = New SignatureCapture2() SigCap.Scenario1.BarcodeMask = "*" SigCap.Scenario1.Apply()
Dim retValue As String = SigCap.Scenario1.BarcodeMask End Sub
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets the level of projective mapping, which adjusts the resolution of captured images.
After you set this property, call Scenario.Apply to save and apply all changes to Scenario properties.
When projective mapping is enabled, the area captured is adjusted to a different size:
Automatic adjusts the resolution automatically.
Fixed adjusts the size of the capture to a preset width based on the narrowest element. For example, "Fixed_1Pixel" adjusts the capture size so that the narrowest bar code element is 1 pixel wide.
When projective mapping is disabled, the system returns the smallest rectangle image.
Set projective mapping to a fixed value to ensure that the captured image is always the same size. If projective mapping is set to a fixed value and the captured image is larger than the original image, the system sends a signature capture failure event with the "invalid parameters" failure code.
Throws exception with invalided property value.
This example sets and gets Projective Mapping Resolution value.
private Intermec.DataCollection.SignatureCapture2 SigCap; public frmSignatureCapture() { InitializeComponent(); SigCap = new SignatureCapture2(); SigCap.Scenario1.ProjectiveMappingResolution = scenario.ProjectiveMappingResolutionType.Automatic; SigCap.Scenario1.Apply();
string retValue = SigCap.Scenario1.ProjectiveMappingResolution.ToString(); }
Private WithEvents SigCap As Intermec.DataCollection.SignatureCapture2 Private Sub frmSignatureCapture_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load SigCap = New SignatureCapture2() SigCap.Scenario1.ProjectiveMappingResolution = scenario.ProjectiveMappingResolutionType.Automatic SigCap.Scenario1.Apply()
Dim retValue As String = SigCap.Scenario1.ProjectiveMappingResolution.ToString() End Sub
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.SignatureCapture2
member.summary: If your Intermec computer is equipped with an imager, this class allows you to perform signature capture.

remarks.para: Any public static (Shared in Visual Basic) members of this type are safe for multi-threaded operations. Instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe and each instance should be used only within a single thread.

Your Intermec computer must have SSPB v5.25 or later to support the SignatureCapture2 class. To check this firmware version, open Intermec Settings on the computer and choose Device Settings > System Component Versions.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.SignatureCapture2.LightGoal
member.summary: Specifies the goal for the average lighting of images. Value Range 0 - 255.

remarks.para: The lighting goal is the average light intensity that the scanner tries to achieve when capturing an image. If the lighting goal is set too low, the image will be dark (underexposed). If it is set too high the image will be too bright (overexposed).
Range is 20 to 200 for most Intermec computers. Default is 100 (60 for CK61 only). Check Intermec Settings on the computer to determine the exact range for your computer and configuration.
remarks.note: The Light Goal setting applies to all scenarios.

member.exception: throws exception if failed on sets or gets LightGoal value.
throws exception in input value is not correct.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.CaptureEventArgs.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an instance of CaptureEventArgs class and passes file name and scenario information.
member.param:
Complete name for the capture image file, in this format: Filename-Scenario-Padding.OutputFormat. Where:
Filename is the name for the file set by Scenario.Filename.
Scenario is the number of the scenario (1 to 4) that triggered the capture. The scenario is a property of the SignatureCapture2 instance.
Padding is the increment (counter or date and time) set by Scenario.FilePadding.
OutputFormat is the format (.jpg or .bmp) set by Scenario.FileOutputFormat.
Number of the scenario (1 to 4) that triggered the image capture. Note that this is duplicated in the Filename string.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.utilities
member.summary: Summary description for utilities.

summary.para: Common helper class for setting properties and filters for images created by Intermec imagers.
Properties of this class configure image conditioning settings, which apply digital processing to images generated by the and classes.

remarks.para: This class is instantiated when you create an instance of the DocumentCapture class.

Two objects of this class are created when you create an instance of the Imager class. One object applies to streaming images and the other applies to SnapShot images. These objects are available through either the Field or the Field.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.ContrastEnhancement
member.summary: Controls whether the image contrast is enhanced. Adjusts brightness and contrast automatically when used.
member.exception: Throws an exception on input value errors.
Throws an exception on set and get errors.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.TextEnhancement
member.summary: Enables text enhancement, which controls the readability of text in the image.
member.remarks: This property sets the level to which contrast changes in an image are exaggerated. By exaggerating the contrast between black text and its white background, it can make text more readable, but too high a level can induce visual noise due to uneven lighting, wrinkled surfaces, or other variables. Choose the lowest level that provides readable text. A value of None turns off text enhancement.
member.exception: Throws an exception on input value errors.
Throws an exception on set and get errors.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.ImageRotation
member.summary: Rotates the image counterclockwise from its original position by the specified amount.
member.remarks: If you also set , this property is applied first. For best results, do not apply this property if you specify FlipPicture.
member.exception: Throws an exception on input value errors.
Throws an exception on set and get errors.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.Subsampling
member.summary: Reduces image size and therefore transfer time, by averaging sets of pixels into one new pixel. If full resolution is unneeded, reducing this setting can lower computation time and reduce memory consumption.

remarks.para: Includes horizontal and vertical grouping, so 1 of 2 would be 1/4 the as large as none. 1 of 8 = 1/64th etc.

member.exception: Throws an exception on input value errors.
Throws an exception on set and get errors.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.NoiseReduction

summary.para: This setting helps reduce the noise resulting from the edge enhancement process. If set to 0, this filtering stage is disabled. The higher the setting value, the higher the filtering.

remarks.para: Use this carefully as it may also add some blur.

para.note: Sets it to 0 (zero) for no noise reduction. Values outside of this range will be limited to the edges of the range.

member.exception: Throws an exception on input value errors.
Throws an exception on set and get errors.

member.summary: Controls the image lighting correction. Enable this to correct for non-uniform lighting conditions.
member.exception: Throws an exception on input value errors.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.Brightness
member.summary: Lightens or darkens the image. Range is -100 to 100, where -100 is darkest and 100 is lightest.
member.exception: Throws an exception on input value errors.
Throws an exception on set and get errors.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.ColorMode
member.summary: Sets the color mode. When set to None, gets the default either color image or grayscale image. When set to Monochrome, image content is black and white. This is commonly used for images containing text. Use to set relative levels of brightness or darkness of the image.

remarks.para: Black and white are commonly used for images containing text. The resulting image will be clearer and use less memory. Use ColorModeValue parameters to adjust the binarisation threshold. Normally used for pictures of text.

para.note: Monochrome choices only really work with TIFF. Monochrome_Enhanced_TIFF_Quality causes an algorithm that doubles the file size but generally produces a higher quality image.

member.exception: Throws an exception on input value errors.
Throws an exception on set and get errors.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.ColorModeBrightnessThreshold
member.summary: Sets the relative level at which grayscale pixels are converted to black or white when is set to Monochrome.
member.remarks: Only applies to TIFF, determines threshold of conversion VeryDark means light gray is converted to black.
member.exception: Throws an exception on input value errors.
Throws an exception on set and get errors.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.OutputCompression
member.summary: Sets the output file type of the document capture image.
member.remarks: JPEG compression is efficient on grayscale pictures, and uses the setting for the output quality if JPEG is selected.
member.exception: Throws an exception on input value errors.

The computer does not have a Data LED.

example.code: Imports Intermec.DataCollection Public Class frmBarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection.BarcodeReader Private Sub frmBarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New BarcodeReader() Catch exp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(ex.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions
member.summary: Use this class to set preamble, postamble, global symblogy ID, and multicode for bar code symbologies.

remarks.para: Any public static (Shared in Visual Basic) members of this type are safe for multi-threaded operations. Instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe and each instance should be used only within a single thread.
To use the SymbologyOptions class, the bcSymbologyMapping.xml file must be in the Windows directory of the Intermec computer.
This Resource Kit includes bcSymbologyMapping.xml. The file is located in the Data Collection Resource Kit\Runtime directory.
The Multicode requires itcscan.dll and bcSymbologyMapping.xml with version 4.02.00.1585 or higher. The Multicode options must supported in Intermec Settings.
remarks.note: For more information on symbology attributes and how they apply to your Intermec computer, see the Intermec Computer Command Reference Manual (P/N 073528).

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of the SymbologyOptions class using the default scanner
member.remarks: For the CV41 and CV61 computers, this constructor connects a tethered scanner to COM1.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.#ctor(System.String)

summary.para: Creates an instance of the SymbologyOptions class using a specified scanner.
Note: Multiple simultaneous instances of this class are not supported.

member.param: Use "default" for the default scanner, "ExtScanner" for a tethered scanner, "BTScanners" for bluetooth scanners

list.item: For the CV41 and CV61, specify "default" for scanners connected to COM1, and specify "ExtScanner" for scanners connected to COM2.
For the CV60 and CV30, use "ExtScanner_1" if you are connecting the scanner to COM1. Otherwise, ExtScanner assumes the scanner is connected to COM2 on the CV60, or COM3 on CV30.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.EnableSymbologyOptionsExceptions(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable/Disable using SymbologyOptionException for sets/gets properties.
member.param: True for throw the SymbologyOptionException when a invalid value occur with set/get properties.
member.remarks: See constructor for common exceptions.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.EnableDataMapperLog(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable generate a data log file for setting/getting property values. When enabled, a SDKDataMapperLog.xml file is generated in root directory of device.
member.param: True, for generate a log file. False, for not generate a log file.
member.example:
This example enables the SDKDataMapperLog.xml file with preamble setting.
symbOption.EnableDataMapperLog(true); symbOption.Preamble = "Martin";
symbOptions.EnableDataMapperLog(True) symbOptions.Preamble = "Martin"
The SDKDataMapperLog.xmL is generated in root directory of device. It looks like:
<?xml version="1.0" ?> <SetCfgEventLog> <Event Call="FormatSetXML"> <Subsystem Name="Data Collection"> <Group Name="Scanners" Instance="1"> <Group Name="Symbology Options"> <Field Name="Preamble">Martin</Field> </Group> </Group> </Subsystem> </Event> <Event Call="SetValueXMLReturned"> <Subsystem Name="Data Collection"> <Group Name="Scanners" Instance="1"> <Group Name="Symbology Options"> <Field Name="Preamble">Martin</Field> </Group> </Group> </Subsystem> </Event> <Event Call="dataMapper::~dataMapper() - destruction" /> </SetCfgEventLog>

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.Preamble
member.summary: Sets or gets the character string (up to 20 characters) that is pre_pended to scanned data.
member.exception: The is set to true.

example.para: If the preamble string is set to "Martin", then a data string such as "305481" is returned as "Martin305481."
Following example sets and gets preamble. The symbOption is a instance of SymbologyOptions class.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.Postamble
member.summary: Sets or gets the character string (up to 20 characters) that is appended to scanned data.
member.exception: The is set to true.

example.para: If the postamble is set to "PartNumber", then a data string such as "305481" is returned as "305481PartNumber".
Following example sets and gets postamble. The symbOption is a instance of SymbologyOptions class.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.EnableMulticode
member.summary: Sets and gets the multicode activation status.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.NumberOfBarcodes
member.summary: Sets and gets the number of bar codes in a multicode.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.BarcodeSeparator
member.summary: Sets and gets the character string (up to 4 characters)used as a separator between each bar code if Multicode is enabled.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.CompleteMulticode
member.summary: Sets and gets a user-defined symbology identifier (UDSI) of 0 to 4 characters for a complete multicode. The UDSI is transmitted as "[UDSI symbology id] <data>"
member.remarks: If there is no characters for Complete Multicode and the symbology identifier transmission is active, no symbology identifier will be sent for this symbology only.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.IncompleteMulticode
member.summary: Sets and gets a user-defined symbology identifier (UDSI) of 0 to 4 characters for an incomplete multicode. The UDSI is transmitted as "[UDSI symbology id] <data>
member.remarks: If there is no characters for Incomplete Multicode UDSI and symbology identifier transmission is active, no symbology identifier will be sent for this symbology only.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.IncompleteTransmission
member.summary: Sets and gets incomplete transmission status. When enabled, the UDSI for an incomplete multicode is transmitted after a timeout.
member.remarks: If using symbology identifiers (code mark or UDSI), the identifier is different for an incomplete transmission than for a complete.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.IncompleteTransmissionTimeout
member.summary: Sets and gets the incomplete transmission timeout (0 to 65535 milliseconds) when incomplete transmission is enabled, the incomplete multicode UDSI is sent after this timeout. The timeout starts after the last bar code is read.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.CBARCODE1
member.summary: Sets length, mask, and symbology type for the first bar code in a multicode

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.CBARCODE1.setScannerPort(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the scanner name of Barcode 1.
member.param: Scanner name that is used for Barcode 1 settings.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.CBARCODE1.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the scanner name of Barcode 1.
member.param: Scanner name that is used for Barcode 1 settings.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.CBARCODE1.Symbology
member.summary: Sets and gets the symbology type for the first bar code in a multicode symbology.
member.remarks: The bar codes are sent in the order they are defined by the bar code ID. If no bar code ID is used and the multicode function is applied to all bar codes, they will be set in the order read.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.CBARCODE1.Length
member.summary: Sets and gets the length of bar code 1 in a multicode symbology. If any length is acceptable, set this property to 0.
member.remarks: Range is 0 to 65535.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions.CBARCODE1.Mask
member.summary: Sets and gets a mask (up to 26 characters) for the first bar code in a multicode symbology.
member.remarks:
The mask is used as a filter to determine which incoming data will be used for first barcode in the multicode. No mask is used if there is no character.
* = zero or more character
? = one character
\ + wildcard = a backslash plus a special character takes away the wildcard function
\c = non-numerical value
\N = numerical value
member.exception: The is set to true.

list.item: *123* = any code with a consecutive 123.
???A* = any code with A in the fourth position followed by zero or more characters.
*1\*3* = any code with a consecutive 1*3 anywhere in the data.
\C* = any code that starts with a non-numerical value.
*\N* = any code that contains a numerical value.

example.para: Following example sets the mask for barcode 1 to *123*. This means any bar code with a consecutive 123 is the first bar code in a multicode. It also retrieves the setting.
example.code: Private Sub frmSymbologyOption_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load symbOptions = New SymbologyOptions() symbOptions.Barcode1.Mask = "*123*" Dim mask As String = Me.symbOptions.Barcode1.Mask End Sub

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptionsException
member.summary: This class is the exception thrown by the class when is set to true.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptionsException.hResult
member.summary: Error value of the error.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptionsException.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Passing the error value and message for symbology options exceptions.
member.remarks: The must set to true in order to use SymbologyOptionsException.

item.description: Make sure the bcSymbologyMapping.xml file is in the Windows directory on the Intermec computer.
Make sure the input value is no more than 20 ASCII characters in length.
Make sure the input value is correct.

example.code: Private Sub Form1_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try symbOptions = New Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyOptions() symbOptions.EnableSymbologyOptionsExceptions(True) symbOptions.Preamble = "Martin" Catch exp As SymbologyOptionsException MessageBox.Show(exp.Message) End Try End Sub

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyException
member.summary: This class is the exception thrown by the class when is set to true.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyException.hResult
member.summary: Error value.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.SymbologyException.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Passing the error value and message for symbology exceptions.

item.description: Make sure the bcSymbologyMapping.xml file is in the Windows directory on the Intermec computer.
Make sure the input value is no more than 4 ASCII characters in length.
Make sure the input value is between 0 to 255.
Make sure the input value is between 0 to 64.
Make sure the input value is correct.

member.remarks: The must set to true in order to use SymbologyException.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology
member.summary: Use Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology to set decoding and attribute options for bar code symbologies.
member.remarks:
Any public static (Shared in Visual Basic) members of this type are safe for multi-threaded operations. Instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe and each instance should be used only within a single thread.
To use the CSymbology class, the bcSymbologyMapping.xml file must be in the Windows directory of the Intermec computer.
This Resource Kit includes bcSymbologyMapping.xml in the Data Collection Resource Kit\Runtime dirctory.
For more information on symbology attributes and how they apply to your Intermec computer, see the Intermec Computer Command Reference Manual.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor for default scanner.
member.remarks: For the CV41 and CV61 computers, this constructor connects a tethered scanner to COM1.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Overload constructor using a specified scanner.

remarks.list:
If you are using a tethered scanner, specify scannerPort as follows:
For the CV41 and CV61, specify "default" for scanners connected to COM1, and specify "ExtScanner" for scanners connected to COM2.
For the CN3 Series and CN4 series computers, specify "ExtScanner" only if you are using a tethered scanner (SR30 or SR60T) connected to the Model AV6 or AV9 vehicle dock.
For the CV60 and CV30, use ExtScanner_1 if you are Connecting the scanner to COM1. Otherwise, ExtScanner assumes the scanner is connected to COM2 on the CV60, Or COM3 on the CV30.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.EnableSymbologyExceptions(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables the throwing of exceptions if a get/set of a symbology property fails.
member.param: Set to true to throw SymbologyExceptions when invalid values occur with sets/gets properties.
member.remarks: See Constructor for common exceptions.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.EnableDataMapperLog(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable/disable generate a data log file for set/get values.
member.param: True, for generate a log file. False, for not generate a log file
member.example:
This example enables the SDKDataMapperLog.xml file with Code39 enabling.
using Intermec.DataCollection; namespace DataCollection { public partial class frmCSymbology : Form { private Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology symb; public frmCSymbology() { InitializeComponent(); try { symb = new CSymbology("default"); symb.EnableDataMapperLog(true); symb.Code39.Enable = true; } catch (SymbologyException exp) { MessageBox.Show(exp.Message); } } } }
Imports Intermec.DataCollection Public Class frmCSymbology Private symb As Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology Private Sub frmCSymbology_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try symb = New CSymbology() symb.EnableDataMapperLog(True) symb.Code39.Enable = True Catch ex As SymbologyException MessageBox.Show(ex.Message) End Try End Sub End Class
The SDKDataMapperLog.xmL is generated in root directory of device. It looks like:
<?xml version="1.0" ?> <SetCfgEventLog> <Event Call="FormatSetXML"> <Subsystem Name="Data Collection"> <Group Name="Scanners" Instance="1"> <Group Name="Symbologies"> <Group Name="Code 39"> <Field Name="Enable Code 39">1</Field> </Group> </Group> </Group> </Subsystem> </Event> <Event Call="SetValueXMLReturned"> <Subsystem Name="Data Collection"> <Group Name="Scanners" Instance="1"> <Group Name="Symbologies"> <Group Name="Code 39"> <Field Name="Enable Code 39">1</Field> </Group> </Group> </Group> </Subsystem> </Event> <Event Call="dataMapper::~dataMapper() - destruction" /> </SetCfgEventLog>

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.SetCfgValuesFromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Sets bar code symbology attributes from an XML file.
member.param: Name of XML file that includes bar code symbology attributes to set

example.para: This example enables Code39 with full ASCII conversion and a user-defined symbology ID with default scanner.

Assume a SymbologyCfgFile.xml file is in the root directory of device and its xml string as below. The Name attribute in the Field element is the name of the symbology attribute to set. The Instance value of Scanners defines the scanner to be set.
example.code: <Subsystem Name="Data Collection" Version="2.0"> <Group Name="Scanners" Instance="0" Version="2.0"> <Group Name="Symbologies"> <Group Name="Code 39"> <Field Name="Enable Code 39">1</Field> <Group Name="Options"> <Field Name="Full ASCII Conversion">1</Field> <Field Name="User defined symbology ID">B1</Field> </Group> </Group> </Group> </Group> </Subsystem>

Imports Intermec.DataCollection Public Class frmCSymbology Private symb As Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology Private Sub frmCSymbology_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load symb = New CSymbology() symb.SetCfgValuesFromFile("\SymbologyCfgFile.xml") Me.ListBox1.Items.Add("Enable = " + symb.Code39.Enable.ToString()) Me.ListBox1.Items.Add("Full ASCII Conversion = " + symb.Code39.fullAsciiConversion.ToString()) Me.ListBox1.Items.Add("UDSI = " + symb.Code39.UserDefinedSymbologyId.ToString()) End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE39.Enable
member.summary: Set to true to enable Code 39 decoding, or set to false to disable decoding.
member.remarks: The Code39 character set consists 43 characters except when full ASCII conversion is enabled.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE39.fullAsciiConversion
member.summary: Enables or disables full ASCII decoding.
member.remarks: The Code39 bar codes are transmitted with an extended character set when Code39 full ASCII conversion enabled. The full 128 ASCII character set is encoded in Code39 by combining two regular Code39 characters.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.summary: Set to true to enable Start Stop Transmission, or set to false to disable Start Stop Transmission.
member.remarks: Start/Stop transmission option does not alter Full ASCII conversions or Lengths count.
member.exception: The is set to true.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection Public Class frmCSymbology Private symb As Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology Private Sub frmCSymbology_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load symb = New CSymbology()

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE39.lengthMode
member.summary: Specifies acceptable bar code length. Length1, length2, and length3 are used differently depending on this property.
member.remarks: When Length 1 is et to 0, no length is specified and any length of 3 or more characters is accepted.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE39.length1
member.summary: Integer value specifying bar code length1.

remarks.para: Use Length 1, Length2, and Length 3 to compose a acceptable bar code lengths depending on the length mode. Minimum length for Code39 is 3 characters. Bar Code length = <start> + <bar code data> + [check digit] + <stop>
Note: When Length 1, Length2, Length 3 and length mode are set to 0, no length is specified and any length of characters is accepted.

member.exception: The is set to true.

member.summary: Specifies symbology ID type.
member.remarks: Supported only by CK30 and CK31. Make sure the computer has been configured to use the Trakker Antares decode algorithm.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE39.UserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: String (0 to 4 characters) specifying a user-defined symbology ID if not using the AIM standard. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [UDSI symbology id]<data>.

remarks.para: The default user-defined symbology ID value is B1.

In order to transmitted the custom identifier, the symbology identifier transmission must be enabled. If the UDSI has zero character and symbolgoy identifier transmission is enabled, no symbology identifier will be sent for this symbology only.

member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE39.CodeMark
member.summary: Compose a one character code mark sysmbology identifier for this symbology. The code mark is transmitted as following: [code mark symbology id]<data>.
member.remarks: Allows 1 ASCII character, or 1 non-printable ASCII character such as "\x12".
member.exception: The is set to true.

example.code:

'set CodeMark symb.Code39.CodeMark = "*" 'get CodeMark value Dim strValue As String = symb.Code39.CodeMark.ToString() End Sub End Class

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE39.ESymbologyId
member.summary: An enum data type for the property.
member.remarks:
Use following character to specify a bar code symbology using the AIM format. Precede symbology ID characters with ']':
Character Modifier Characters
A
0: No check character validation nor full ASCII processing. All data trasmitted as decoded.
1: Modulo 43 check character validated and transmitted.
3: Modulo 43 check character validated but not transmitted.
4: Full ASCII character conversion performed. No check character validation.
5: Full ASCII character conversion performed. Modulo 43 check character validated and transmitted.
7: Full ASCII character conversion performed. Modulo 43 check character validated but not transmitted.
For more information, see the latest ISO/IEC Data Carrier/Symbology Identifiers documentation.

member.summary: Set to true to enable UPC-A Number System Transmission, or set to false to disable it.
member.remarks: UPC-A has transmitted number system equal to 0. To transmit the additional leading character (country code), select "UPC-A transmitted as EAN-13" option. The number system is transmitted as: <leading character><number system><data><check digit>

member.summary: Set to true to enable UPC-A Transmitted as EAN-13, or set to false to disable it. Transmission only takes into account the parameters available for the target bar code format.
member.remarks: For all conversions, the symbology identifier (AIM or user defined) is based on destination symbology.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CEANUPC.UPCEXmitAsUPCA
member.summary: Set to true to enable UPC-E Transmitted as UPC-A, or set to false to disable it. Transmission only takes into account only the parameters available for the target bar code format.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CEANUPC.Ean8XmitAsEan13
member.summary: Set to true to enable EAN-8 Transmitted as EAN-13, or set to false to disable it. Transmission takes into account only the parameters available for the target bar code format.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CEANUPC.IsbnConversionForEan13
member.summary: Set to true to enable ISBN Conversion for EAN-13, or set to false to disable it. If enabled, no add-on is transmitted even if required.

remarks.para: Converts all EAN-13 bar codes beginning with "978" or "979" (except for "9790" by removing the first 3 digits, calculating the checksum on the remaining characters, and adding the ISBN (International Standard Book Number) check digit.
remarks.note: No conversion if GTIN is active.

member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CEANUPC.IsmnConversionForEan13
member.summary: Set to true to enable ISMN Conversion, or set to false to disable it.

remarks.para: When enabled, it converts all EAN-13 bar codes beginning with "9790" by removing the first 3 digits and replacing the "0" with "M." This creates the International Standard Music Number (ISMN).
remarks.note: No conversion is done if GTIN processing is active.

member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CEANUPC.IssnConversionForEan13
member.summary: Set to true to enable ISSN Conversion, or set to false to disable it.

remarks.para: When enabled, it converts all EAN-13 bar codes beginning with "977" by removing the first 3 digits and adding the ISBN check digit. This creates the International Standard Serial Number (ISSN).
remarks.note: No conversion is done if GTIN processing is active.

member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CEANUPC.GtinCompliant
member.summary: Set to true to enable GTIN Compliant, or set to false to disable it.
member.remarks: Enable or disable GTIN processing for all UPC/EAN symbologies. GTIN stands for "Global Trade Item Number" and transmits UPC/EAN symbologies as the 14 character EAN.UCC GTIN.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CEANUPC.EUPCASymbologyId
member.summary: An enum data type for the property.
member.remarks:
Use following character to specify a bar code symbology using the AIM format. Precede symbology ID characters with ']':
Character Modifier Characters
E
0: Standard data packet in full EAN format (13 digits for EAN-13, UPC-A, and UPC-E; does not include add-on data).
1: Two digit add-on data only.
2: Five digit add-on data only.
3: Combined data packet comprising 13 digits from EAN-13, UPC-A, or UPC-E symbol and 2 or 5 digits from add-on symbol.
4: EAN-8 data packet.
For more information, see the latest ISO/IEC Data Carrier/Symbology Identifiers documentation.

member.summary: User defined symbolgy identifier symbology ID.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.Enable
member.summary: Set to true to enable Code 128 decoding, or set to false to disable decoding.
member.exception: The is set to true.

members.member: Deprecate this property in DCRK3.50 Deprecated, replaced by GS1-128.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.GS1_128
member.summary: Set to true to enable GS1-128 decoding, or set to false to diable decoding.
member.remarks: Enable GS1-128 permits to decode code 128 with FNC1 in 1st position. This symbology is subject to identical Code 128 constraints (length, Reading tolerance.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.Ean128Identifier
member.summary: Deprecated, replaced by GS1-128Identifier.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.GS1_128Identifier
member.summary: Set to true to enable the AIM identifier characters, or set to false to disable the characters.
member.remarks: According the GS1-128 norm, the AIM identifier " ]C1 " is added by default in front of each GS1-128 bar code as follows: ]C1 <data>
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.ISBT128
member.summary: Set to true to enable ISBT-128 decoding, or set to false to disable decoding.
member.remarks: Intermec recommends disabling Code 128 and GS1-128 when activating ISBT 128. This avoids confusing between the different bar codes.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.isbtConcatTrans
member.summary: Selects the transmission mode for concatenated ISBT 128 codes.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.ConcatenateISBTCodes
member.summary: Set to true to enable ISBT 128 Concatenation, or set to false to disable Concatenation.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.GTINcompliant
member.summary: Set to true to enable GTIN processing, or set to false to disable GTIN processing.
member.remarks: Only GS1-128 codes of at least 16 characters and beginning with "01" can be processed. Non-compliant GS1-128 codes are not read when GTIN processing is active.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.checkDigitVerify
member.summary: Enable or disable French CIP check digit verification, used for the French pharmaceutical industry.

remarks.para: If French CIP check digit is active, decoding only succeeds if barcode length is 14 characters, start is C type, and CIP check digit is verified.
remarks.note: French CIP activation does not force minimum length to 14.

member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.readerTolerance
member.summary: Sets and gets the tolerance level for reading "hard to read" bar codes.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.summary: An enum data type for the property.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.EISBTConcatTrans.Disable
member.summary: Codes are always transmitted as single codes (no concatenation).

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.EISBTConcatTrans.ConcatenatedCodes
member.summary: Only transmits concatenated codes, does not transmit single codes.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.EISBTConcatTrans.ConcatOrSingleCodes
member.summary: Single codes and concatenated codes are both transmitted. If the product can only "see" one code of a code pair it will send that code as a single code. If the product "sees" both codes of a pair it will concatenate the codes depending on the concatenation mode setting.

member.summary: An enum data type for the property.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.EReaderTolerance.High
member.summary: Sets high reading tolerance. Most permissive (reads codes of variable quality)

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.EReaderTolerance.Medium
member.summary: Sets medium reading tolerance.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.EReaderTolerance.Low
member.summary: Sets low reading tolerance. Least permissive - reads only codes that meet the standard for the symbology.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.ELengthMode
member.summary: An enum data type for the property.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.ELengthMode.Length1Minimum
member.summary: Codes with as many characters as specified by Length1 and longer are read. Length2 and Length3 are not used.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.ELengthMode.Lengths1_2_3Fixed
member.summary: Only codes that comply with the lengths specified by Length1, Length2 and Length3 will be read.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.ELengthMode.Length1_minimum_Length2_maximum
member.summary: Codes that are at least the minimum length specified by Length1 and not longer than the maximum length specified by Length2 are read. Length3 is not used.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE128.ESymbologyId
member.summary: An enum data type for the property.
member.remarks:
Use following character to specify a bar code symbology using the AIM format. Precede symbology ID characters with ']':
Character Modifier Characters
C
0: Standard data packet. No FNC1 in first or second symbol character position after start character.
1: EAN/UCC-128 data packet. FNC1 in first symbol character position after start character.
2: FNC1 in second symbol character position after start character.
4: Concatenation according to International Society for Blood Transfusion specifications has been performed. Concatenated data follows.
For UCC/EAN128 emulation mode, use ']C1' for the symbology ID.
For more information, see the latest ISO/IEC Data Carrier/Symbology Identifiers documentation.

member.summary: AIM ISO/IEC Standard.

member.summary: User Defined Symbology identifier.

member.summary: Set to true to enable Interleaved 2 of 5 decoding, or set to false to disable decoding.
member.remarks: Enabling this symbology does not ensure decoding will be possible for any barcode read. Some options can prevent from decoding (Length, check digit..)

member.summary: Selects the Interleaved 2 of 5 case code type.
