member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CINTERLEAVED2OF5.verifyCheckDigit
member.summary: Specifies check digit verification type.
member.remarks: Activating one type of check digit deactivates all other check digits.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CINTERLEAVED2OF5.TransmitCheckDigit
member.summary: Set to true to enable check digit transmission, or set to false to disable transmission.
member.remarks: Check digit transmitted or not, do not impact length counts.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CINTERLEAVED2OF5.readingTolerance
member.summary: Sets the tolerance level for reading "hard to read" bar codes.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CINTERLEAVED2OF5.lengthMode
member.summary: Specifies acceptable bar code length.

remarks.para: Use Length1, Length2 and Length3 to compose a acceptable bar code lengths depending on the Length mode used. Minimum length for Interleaved 2 of 5 is 4 characters: Bar code length = <bar code data> + [check digit].
remarks.note: When Length1, Length2, Length3 and length mode are set to 0, no length is specified and any length of characters is accepted.

member.exception: The is set to true.

member.summary: Integer value specifying bar code length1. Range is 0 - 255.
member.remarks: For computers using the 1400, 1551, 1551E, or 1800 scanners, range is 2 - 50.

member.summary: An enum data type for the property.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CINTERLEAVED2OF5.EReadingTolerance.High
member.summary: This is the most permissive mode. When enabled, the scanner reads codes of variable quality.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CINTERLEAVED2OF5.EReadingTolerance.Medium
member.summary: This mode allows medium permissiveness.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CINTERLEAVED2OF5.EReadingTolerance.Low
member.summary: This is the least permissive mode. When enabled, the scanner reads only high quality codes that meet the official Interleaved 2 of 5 standards.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CINTERLEAVED2OF5.ELengthMode
member.summary: An enum data type for the property.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CINTERLEAVED2OF5.ELengthMode.Length1Minimum
member.summary: Codes with as many characters as specified by Length1 and longer are read. Length2 and Length3 are not used.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CINTERLEAVED2OF5.ELengthMode.Lengths1_2_3Fixed
member.summary: Only codes that comply with the lengths specified by Length1, Length2 and Length3 will be read.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CINTERLEAVED2OF5.ELengthMode.Length1_minimum_Length2_maximum
member.summary: Codes that are at least the minimum length specified by Length1 and not longer than the maximum length specified by Length2 are read. L3 is not used.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CINTERLEAVED2OF5.ESymbologyId
member.summary: An enum data type for the property.
member.remarks:
Use following character to specify a bar code symbology using the AIM format. Precede symbology ID characters with ']':
Character Modifier Characters
I
0: No check character validation.
1: Modulo 10 symbol check character validated and transmitted.
3: Modulo 10 symbol check character validated but not transmitted.
For more information, see the latest ISO/IEC Data Carrier/Symbology Identifiers documentation.

member.summary: No symbology ID.

member.summary: AIM ISO/IEC Standard symbology ID.

member.summary: User-defined symbology ID.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE93.lengthMode
member.summary: Specifies acceptable bar code length.

remarks.para: The Length1, Length2, and Length3 are used differently depending on the length mode.
remarks.note: when Length1, Length2, Length3 and length mode are set to 0, no length is specified and any length of character is accepted.

member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE93.length1
member.summary: Integer value specifying length1. Range is 0 - 255.

remarks.para: Minimum length for Code93 is 1 character: Bar code length = <bar code data>.
Note: when Length1 is set to 0 no length is specified and any length of 3 or more character is accepted.

member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE93.length2

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE93.length3

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE93.UserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: String (0 to 4 ASCII characters) specifying a user-defined symbology ID if not using the AIM standard. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [USDI symbology id]<data>.

remarks.para: The default user-defined symbology ID value is B6.
If there is 0 character and symbology identifier transmission is enabled, no symbology identifier will set for this symbology only.

member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODE93.CodeMark
member.summary: Compose a one character code mark sysmbology identifier for this symbology. The code mark is transmitted as following: [code mark symbology id]<data>.
member.remarks: Allows 1 ASCII character, or 1 non-printable ASCII character such as "\x12".
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODABAR.CLSILibrarySystem
member.summary: Set to true to enable Codabar CLSI library systme, or set to false to disable the library system.
member.remarks: The CLSI library system for Codabar inserts spaces after characters 1, 5, and 10 in the 14-character label. Start/stop characters can be transmitted or not transmitted as required. This system is used by some libraries in the USA.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODABAR.VerifyCheckDigit

member.summary: Set to true to enable Codabar check digit transmission, or set to false to disable check digit transmission.
member.remarks: Only applicable if check digit verification is enabled. Lengths verification (see lengths Length1 Length2 Length3 length mode) does not include check digit character.

member.summary: Specifies acceptable bar code length. Length1, Length2, and Length3 are used differently depending on the length mode.

member.summary: Only transmit concatenated codes are transmitted. Non-concatenated codes are ignored.

member.summary: Transmit concatenated codes and non-concatenated codes.

member.summary: An enum data type for the property.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODABAR.EConcatenationMode.NoRestriction
member.summary: Concatenates all adjacent codes, intermediate start/stop characters are not transmitted.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODABAR.EConcatenationMode.SecondCodeEquals1stCodeStart
member.summary: First code stop = second code start.
member.example: Only concatenates adjacent codes if the first code stop character is the same as the second code start character (C123456A + A123456D = 123456123456 or C123456123456D if start/stop characters are transmitted).

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODABAR.EConcatenationMode.ABC
member.summary: American Blood Commission (ABC).
member.example: Only concatenates adjacent codes if the stop character of the first code = D and the start character of the second code = D (C123456D + D123456A = 123456123456 or C123456123456A if start/stop characters are transmitted).

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CCODABAR.ESymbologyId
member.summary: An enum data type for the property.
member.remarks:
Use following character to specify a bar code symbology using the AIM format. Precede symbology ID characters with ']':
Character Modifier Characters
F
0: Standard Codabar symbol. No special processing.
1: ABC (American Blood Commission) Codabar concatenate/message append performed.
2: Reader has validated the check character.
4: Reader has stripped the check character before transmission.
For more information, see the latest ISO/IEC Data Carrier/Symbology Identifiers documentation.

member.summary: Set to true to enable MSI decoding, or set to false to disable decoding.

member.summary: Specifies MSI check digit verification type.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CMSI.TransmitCheckDigit
member.summary: Set to true to enable MSI code check digit transmission, or set to false to disable transmission.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CMSI.lengthMode
member.summary: Specifies acceptable bar code length.

remarks.para: Use Length1, Length2 and Length3 to compose acceptable bar code lengths depending on the length mode used. Minimum length for MSI Code is 3 characters. Bar code length = <bar code data> + [check digit]
remarks.note: When Length1, Length2, Length3 and length mode are set to 0, no length is specified and any length of characters is accepted.

member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CMSI.length1
member.summary: Integer value specifying bar code length1. Range is 0 - 255.
member.remarks: For computers using the 1400, 1551, 1551E, or 1800 scanners, range is 2 - 50.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CMSI.length2
member.summary: Integer value specifying bar code length2. Range is 0 - 255.
member.remarks: For computers using the 1400, 1551, 1551E, or 1800 scanners, range is 2 - 50.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CMSI.length3
member.summary: Integer value specifying bar code length3. Range is 0 - 255.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CMSI.symbologyId
member.summary: Specifies symbology ID type.
member.remarks: Supported only by CK30 and CK31. Make sure the computer has been configured to use the Trakker Antares decode algorithm.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CMSI.UserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: String (0 to 4 ASCII characters) specifying a user-defined symbology ID if not using the AIM standard. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [UDSI symbology id] <data>

remarks.para: The default user-defined symbology ID value is B8.
If there is no character and and symbology identifier transmission is active, no symbology identifier will be sent for this symbology only.

member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CMSI.CodeMark
member.summary: Compose a one character code mark sysmbology identifier for this symbology. The code mark is transmitted as following: [code mark symbology id]<data>.
member.remarks: Allows 1 ASCII character, or 1 non-printable ASCII character such as "\x12".
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CTELEPEN.ELengthMode
member.summary: An enum data type for the property.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CTELEPEN.ELengthMode.Length1Minimum
member.summary: Codes with as many characters as specified by Length1 and longer are read. Length2 and Length3 are not used.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CTELEPEN.ELengthMode.Lengths1_2_3Fixed
member.summary: Only codes that comply with the lengths specified by Length1, Length2 and Length3 will be read.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CTELEPEN.ELengthMode.Length1_minimum_Length2_maximum
member.summary: Codes that are at least the minimum length specified by Length1 and not longer than the maximum length specified by Length2 are read. Length3 is not used.

member.summary: Sets scanner name string.

member.summary: Constructor of PDF417 class.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CPDF417.Enable
member.summary: Set to true to enable PDF417 decoding, or set to false to disable decoding.
member.remarks: Enabling this symbology does not ensure decoding will be possible for any barcode read. Some options can prevent from decoding (Length)
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CPDF417.MacroPDFBuffered
member.summary: Set to true to enable MacroPDF buffering, or set to false to disable it. When enabled, multi-labeled PDF417 messages are stored in the scanner buffer until the whole message has been read. Once it has been read it is transmitted. Bar codes can be read in any order.
member.remarks: MacroPDF buffering is not supported by the 1400, 1551, 1551E, or 1800 scanners.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CPDF417.ControlHeaderTransmission
member.summary: Set to true to enable Control header Transmission, or set to false to disable it. The control header is always transmitted when using Macro PDF417 UnBuffered.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CPDF417.OptionalFieldsFileNameXmit

member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CPDF417.PDFWithDataLengthID0
member.summary: Enables Irregular PDF. When enabled, PDF417 labels with the symbology length descriptor set to 0 can still be read.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CPDF417.UserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: String (0 to 4 ASCII characters) specifying a user-defined symbology ID if not using the AIM standard. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [UDSI symbology id] <data>

remarks.para: The default user-defined symbology ID value is C7.
If there is no character and symbology identifier transmission is active, no symbology identifier will be sent for this symbology only.

member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CPDF417.CodeMark
member.summary: Compose a one character code mark sysmbology identifier for this symbology. The code mark is transmitted as following: [code mark symbology id]<data>.
member.remarks: Allows 1 ASCII character, or 1 non-printable ASCII character such as "\x12".
member.exception: The is set to true.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection Public Class frmCSymbology Private symb As Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology Private Sub frmCSymbology_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load symb = New CSymbology()
'set CodeMark symb.Pdf417.CodeMark = "*" 'get CodeMark value Dim strValue As String = symb.Pdf417.CodeMark.ToString() End Sub End Class

member.summary: An enum data type for the property.

member.summary: Disable Irregular PDF to read labels with symbol length descriptor set to 0.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CPDF417.EPDFWithDataLengthID0.Enable
member.summary: Enable Irregular PDF to read labels with symbol length descriptor set to 0.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CPDF417.ESymbologyId
member.summary: An enum data type for the property.
member.remarks:
Use following character to specify a bar code symbology using the AIM format. Precede symbology ID characters with ']':
Character Modifier Characters
L
0: Reader set to conform with protocol defined in 1994 PDF 417 specifications.
1: Reader set to follow protocol of ENV 12925 for Extended Channel Interpretation (all data characters 92 doubled).
2: Reader set to follow protocol of ENV 12925 for Basic Channel Interpretation (data characters 92 are not doubled).
3: Code 128 emulation: implied FNC1 in first position.
4: Code 128 emulation: implied FNC1 after initial letter or pair of digits.
5: Code 128 emulation: no implied FNC1.
For more information, see the latest ISO/IEC Data Carrier/Symbology Identifiers documentation.

member.summary: Disable symbology ID.

member.summary: AIM ISO/IEC Standard symbology ID.

member.summary: User Defined symbology ID.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CMICROPDF417.MicroPDFCode128Emulation
member.summary: Set to true to enable Micro PDF Code128 Emulation, or set to false to disable it. When enabled, this option constraints the MicroPDF characters set to EAN128 Characters set. Transmission is identical to EAN128 (i.e. ]C1xxx)
member.remarks: If the option is enabled, and EAN128Idendifier is enabled, microPDF AIM identifier will be forced to ]C1. If the option is enabled, and EAN128Idendifier is disabled, AIM identifier will be ]L3.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CMAXICODE.ESymbologyId
member.summary: An enum data type of the property.
member.remarks:
Use following character to specify a bar code symbology using the AIM format. Precede symbology ID characters with ']':
Character Modifier Characters
U
0: Symbol in Mode 4 or 5.
1: Symbol in Mode 2 or 3.
2: Symbol in Mode 4 or 5, ECI protocol implemented.
3: Symbol in Mode 2 or 3, ECI protocol implemented in secondary message.
For more information, see the latest ISO/IEC Data Carrier/Symbology Identifiers documentation.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CDATAMATRIX.ESymbologyId
member.summary: An enum data type for the property.
member.remarks:
Use following character to specify a bar code symbology using the AIM format. Precede symbology ID characters with ']':
Character Modifier Characters
d
0: ECC 000-140.
1: ECC 200.
2: ECC 200, FNC1 in first or fifth position.
3: ECC 200, FNC1 in second or sixth position.
4: ECC 200, ECI protocol implemented.
5: ECC 200, FNC1 in first or fifth position, ECI protocol implemented.
6: ECC 200, FNC1 in second or sixth position, ECI protocol implemented.
For more information, see the latest ISO/IEC Data Carrier/Symbology Identifiers documentation.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CQRCODE.ESymbologyId
member.summary: An enum data type for the property.
member.remarks:
Use following character to specify a bar code symbology using the AIM format. Precede symbology ID characters with ']':
Character Modifier Characters
Q
0: Model 1 symbol.
1: Model 2 symbol, ECI protocol not implemented.
2: Model 2 symbol, ECI protocol implemented.
3: Model 2 symbol, ECI protocol not implemented, FNC1 implied in first position.
4: Model 2 symbol, ECI protocol implemented, FNC1 implied in first position.
5: Model 2 symbol, ECI protocol not implemented, FNC1 implied in second position.
6: Model 2 symbol, ECI protocol implemented, FNC1 implied in second positio.
For more information, see the latest ISO/IEC Data Carrier/Symbology Identifiers documentation.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CGS1DATABAROMNIDIRECTIONAL.ESymbologyId
member.summary: An enum data type for the property.
member.remarks:
Use following character to specify a bar code symbology using the AIM format. Precede symbology ID characters with ']':
Character Modifier Characters
e0 None
GS1 DataBar Omni-Directional is transmitted as ]e001abcde2, where:
]e0 is the symbology ID.
01 is the application identifier for item identification.
abcde is the encoded data.
2 is a check digit appended to the data string.
For more information, see the latest ISO/IEC Data Carrier/Symbology Identifiers documentation.

member.summary: Constructor of CGS1DATABARLIMITED class.

member.summary: True for enable GS1 DataBar Limited decoding, or false for disable it.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CGS1DATABARLIMITED.symbologyId
member.summary: Specifies type of symbology ID.
member.remarks: Supported only by CK30 and CK31. Make sure the computer has been configured to use the Trakker Antares decode algorithm.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CGS1DATABARLIMITED.UserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: String (0 to 4 ASCII characters) specifying a user-defined symbology ID if not using the AIM standard. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [UDSI symbology id] <data>

remarks.para: The default user-defined symbology ID value is C4.
If there is no character and symbology identifier transmission is active, no symbology identifier will be sent for this symbology only.

member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CGS1DATABARLIMITED.CodeMark
member.summary: Compose a one character code mark sysmbology identifier for this symbology. The code mark is transmitted as following: [code mark symbology id]<data>.
member.remarks: Allows 1 ASCII character, or 1 non-printable ASCII character such as "\x12".
member.exception: The is set to true.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection Public Class frmCSymbology Private symb As Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology Private Sub frmCSymbology_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load symb = New CSymbology()
'set CodeMark symb.GS1DataBarLimited.CodeMark = "*" 'get CodeMark value Dim strValue As String = symb.GS1DataBarLimited.CodeMark.ToString() End Sub End Class

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CGS1DATABARLIMITED.ESymbologyId
member.summary: An enum data type for the property.
member.remarks:
Use following character to specify a bar code symbology using the AIM format. Precede symbology ID characters with ']':
Character Modifier Characters
e0 None
GS1 DataBar Limited is transmitted as ]e001abcde2, where:
]e0 is the symbology ID.
01 is the application identifier for item identification.
abcde is the encoded data.
2 is a check digit appended to the data string.
For more information, see the latest ISO/IEC Data Carrier/Symbology Identifiers documentation.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CGS1COMPOSITE.EAN_UPCCompMsgDecodeType
member.summary: An enum data type for the property.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CGS1COMPOSITE.EAN_UPCCompMsgDecodeType.Never_linked
member.summary: The EAN/UPC bar code is not linked to the 2D composite component - only the EAN/UPC bar code is transmitted.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CGS1COMPOSITE.EAN_UPCCompMsgDecodeType.Always_linked
member.summary: The EAN/UPC bar code is always linked to the 2D composite component - both the EAN/UPC bar code and 2D composite component are transmitted. If a 2D composite component is not present, the UPC bar code is not transmitted.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CGS1COMPOSITE.EAN_UPCCompMsgDecodeType.Auto_discriminate
member.summary: Applies only to imagers. The imager detects if there is a 2D composite component or not and then transmits the data accordingly. This option allows the scanner to send EAN/UPC bar codes only or both the EAN/UPC bar code with the 2D composite component if present.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CTLC39
member.summary: Defines attributes for decoding the TLC39 symbology.
member.remarks: This class requires IVA version 5.01.40.1685 on the Intermec computer and is supported only by Intermec area imagers such as the EA10, EA11, EA21 or EX25.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CTLC39.setScannerPort(System.String)
member.summary: Sets scanner name string.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CTLC39.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor of CTLC39 class.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CTLC39.Enable
member.summary: Set to true to enable TLC39 decoding, or set to false to disable decoding.
member.remarks: To activate TLC 39, you must also activate Micro PDF417 and Code 39 When TLC39 is activated, extended range on standard code 39 is no more available
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CTLC39.LinearOnlyXmitMode
member.summary: Set to true to enableTLC 39 Linear Only Transmission Mode, or set to false to disable it.
member.remarks: In this mode, only data from the Code 39 label is transmitted and the Micro PDF417 data is ignored.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CTLC39.ECISecurity
member.summary: Integer value specifying the security. Range is 0 to 100.
member.remarks: Security operated on TLC39 reading if ECI has been found and code 39 enabled. If code is 6 digit, will attempt to decode a TLC39 ECI part with more security. Greater is the value, more secure will be the decoding but decoding will be less snappy.
member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.CSymbology.CTLC39.UserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: String (0 to 4 ASCII characters) specifying a user-defined symbology ID if not using the AIM standard. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [UDSI symbology id] <data>

remarks.para: The default user-defined symbology ID value is H0.
If there no character and symbology identifier transmission is active, no symbology identifier will be sent for this symbology only.

member.exception: The is set to true.

member.summary: Compose a one character code mark sysmbology identifier for this symbology. The code mark is transmitted as following: [code mark symbology id]<data>.

member.exception: The is set to true.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.ScannerNotifyEventArgs
member.summary: This member class of passes information about scanner events to the application.

remarks.para: Any public static (Shared in Visual Basic) members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. Any instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe.
remarks.note: The event handler works only if "AllScanners" is specified as the DeviceName in the BarcodeReader constructor.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.ScannerNotifyEventArgs.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,Intermec.DataCollection.Device)
member.summary: Creates an instance of ScannerNotifyEventArgs class.
member.param: Type of scanner group event that has occurred.
Type of port state change that has occurred.
Instance of the class used to track scanner information.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.ScannerNotifyEventArgs.GroupEvent
member.summary: Identifies the type of scanner group event that has occurred.
member.remarks:
The NotifyGroupEvent enumeration is defined as:
DeviceAdded: A device was added to the scanner group.
DeviceRemoved: A device was removed from the scanner group.
DevicePortStateChanged: The port state changed for a device in the scanner group.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.ScannerNotifyEventArgs.PortState
member.summary: Identifies the type of port state change that has occurred. Such as DeviceDisabled, DeviceEnabled, DeviceInoperative, DeviceDisconnected.
member.remarks:
The NotifyGroupEvent enumeration is defined as:
DeviceDisabled: This device is disabled.
DeviceEnabled: This device is enabled.
DeviceInoperative: This device is inoperative.
DeviceDisconnected: This device is disconnected.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.ScannerNotifyEventArgs.DeviceInfo
member.summary: Instance of the Device class used to track scanner information.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.Device
member.summary: Represents a scanner device. Use this class to manage all scanners. A preconstructed instance of this class is passed in the event handler when the application gets a scan event.

remarks.para: The class contains device-specific information such as friendly name, port name, and port ID. This class also provides methods to get and set device attributes.

Any public static (Shared in Visual Basic) members of this type are safe for multi-threaded operations. Instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe and each instance should be used only within a single thread.
remarks.note: This class is supported by Intermec computers with IVA version 4.03 and later. Your application may throw an exception if used on computers with previous versions of IVA.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.BarcodeReader.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that sets the scanner name and uses the default buffer (2KB).
member.param: Name of the scanner to be used.
member.remarks:
The BarcodeReader class supports following scanner names:
Multiple simultaneous instances of this class are supported when each instance uses a unique scanner name.
To use the default scanner for your Intermec computer, set DeviceName to "default".
For tethered or external scanners connected to your Intermec computer, use "ExtScanner".
For Bluetooth scanners, use "BTScanners".
For the CV41 and CV61, specify "default" for scanners connected to COM1, and specify "ExtScanner" for scanners connected to COM2.
member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on bar code read methods and properties.

Multiple simultaneous instances of this class are supported when each instance uses a unique scanner name.

For tethered or external scanners connected to your Intermec computer, use "ExtScanner".
For Bluetooth scanners, use "BTScanners".
For the CV41 and CV61, specify "default" for scanners connected to COM1, and specify "ExtScanner" for scanners connected to COM2.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.BarcodeReader.CurrentThreadedReadState
member.summary: Requests data from the scanner and posts an event when scanned data is available. Provides for continuous detection of scanned data, or for detection only after an asynchronous read is re-posted.
member.param:
Boolean value determining whether or not ThreadedRead needs to be called each time:
true = sends the BarcodeRead event after each successful read.
false = sends the BarcodeRead event after a successful read. Requires a new call to ThreadedRead for each subsequent read.
member.exception: Throws an exception when an error has occurred on bar code read methods and properties.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.BarcodeReader.CheckForData
member.summary: This is the worker thread that retrieves the messages in a loop. The worker thread P/Invokes into unmanaged code to ITCSCAN_GetBarcodeMessage. This method will be blocked until new (asynchronous) data is available. If data is available and if we have a listener (event handler), we pass the data on. Note that CheckForData remains active (in combination with the unmanaged DLL), even if there are no listeners for data.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.BarcodeReader.ScannerOn
member.summary: Turns the scanner on or off. must be set to True to set this property.

remarks.para: True turns the scanner on as if you pressed the Scan button or pulled the trigger. False turns the scanner off as if the button or trigger were released.

list.item: true = Turns the scanner on. Scanner stays on until a bar code is read.
false = Turns the scanner off.

remarks.para: This property only sets the state of the data LED (when available) on the Intermec computer, and does not affect the state of the good read LED. Use to set the state of the good read LED.

false = Turns data LED off.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager
member.summary: If your Intermec computer is equipped with an imager, the Intermec.DataCollection.Imager class allows you to use the imager as a simple camera for streaming video and individual snapshots.

remarks.para: Any public static (Shared in Visual Basic) members of this type are safe for multi-threaded operations. Instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe and each instance should be used only within a single thread.

note.para: This class is not supported by the CN50.
To avoid problems, be sure you call Imager.Dispose before you exit the application.
When you create an instance of the Imager class, you also instantiated two instances ( and ) of the class if image conditioning is supported on a device.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.SnapShotConditioning
member.summary: An object of the class for setting SnapShot image conditioning. It is instantiated when an Imager constructor is created if the current device supports image conditioning.

remarks.para: For certain Intermec computers (CN3 and later), additional control is provided to support using different image conditioning settings on SnapShots than on imaging (streaming video). This field points to an object of the class that sets those properties for SnapShots.
To support legacy applications, some parameters passed into SnapShot are used to set the appropriate image conditioning properties.
Use the property to determine if the current device supports image conditioning.

member.exception: Throws an exception on incorrect input value errors.
Throws an exception on get and set errors.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.ImageConditioning
member.summary: An object of class that sets image conditioning properties for streaming video. It is instantiated when an Imager constructor is created if the current device supports image conditioning.

remarks.para: For certain Intermec computers (CN3 and later), additional control is provided to support using different image conditioning settings for SnapShots than for imaging (streaming video). This field points to an object of the class that sets those properties for imaging.
Use the property to determine if the current device supports image conditioning.

This object optimizes the following properties for streaming video:
OutputCompression: Defines if the image is compressed when moving from the imager to the computer. This choice is made by the software based on the imager type and its ability for high speed transfer.
OutputCompressionQuality: Because speed is more important than image quality for streaming video, when JPEG compression is used to transfer the image, the quality is set to 50%.
Subsampling: For best streaming video speed, this is always set to OneOfEight.

member.exception: Throws an exception on incorrect input value errors.
Throws an exception on get and set errors.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor using the default picture box and the default picture resolution size (1 averaged pixel of 16)

remarks.para:
In general, the image resolution sets the amount of detail in the picture. The smaller the resolution, the better the speed of streaming video. The highest image resolutions for Intermec imagers are as follows:
Imager Model Highest Resolution (in Pixels)
EA11 752 x 480
EA20X 752 x 480
EX25a, EX25b 752 x 480
EA21 1280 x 800
To find the imager model, open Intermec Settings on the computer and choose Data Collection > Internal Scanner > Scanner Settings.
For snapshots, PictureResolutionSize can be overridden by specifying a size in or . For streaming video, PictureResolutionSize remains as set in the constructor, unless modified by .
If image conditioning is available, setting the PictureResolutionSize sets both and to the equivalent value. Use of ImageConditioning class for a greater range of image resolutions.

member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on Imager methods and properties.

member.summary: Flag to indicate whether the conditioning objects SnapShotConditioning and ImageConditioning are available on this device.

remarks.para: Use this property at runtime to find out if your Intermec computer supports image conditioning, which provides advanced settings that improve image quality. Image conditioning is supported by most Intermec computers using the EA21 imager.
The SnapShotConditioning and ImageConditioning object pointers are null if image conditioning is not available on the computer where the application is running.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.LightMode
member.summary: Chooses the preferred mode for achieving the desired exposure. Exposure is a function of two parameters: the imager aperture and the LEDs used to light the surface.

remarks.para: The lighting mode determines how the scanner tries to achieve the . Priority can be given to the illumination LEDs or to aperture (exposure time). Using the IllumLedPriority setting results in shorter exposure time, therefore less risk of blurred images.
Use the aperture priority setting when you have a shiny bar code label where high intensity lighting will be too bright to decode it.

note.list:
These values have been deprecated:
LedMode (identical to IllumLEDPriority)
LightMode (identical to AperturePriority)

remarks.para: It is not supported on EA30 scanners.

member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on Imager methods and properties.
Throws exception with invalid input value.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.LightGoal
member.summary: Specifies the goal for the average lighting of images.

remarks.para: Range is 20 to 200 for most Intermec computers (EA11, EA11D, EA11-HD, EA21, EA21D). Range is 0 to 255 for EA20X. And range is 14 to 63 for EX25. Default is 100 (60 for CK61 only). Check Intermec Settings on the computer to determine the exact range for your computer and configuration.
Lower values indicate a smaller aperture, which is fine for decoding most bar codes.
Higher values indicate a wider aperture, which is better for dense bar codes but can lead to focus problems.

note.para: The light goal is the desired "brightness" of the image, representing the best compromise between image brightness and image clarity.

A lower value results in darker images with lower contrast. A higher value produces the brightest images, but increases the chance that the image will be blurred or unfocused, making a bar code in the image hard to decode.
Use the setting to determine how the scanner tries to achieve the lighting goal.

The default setting of 100 is optimal for typical everyday light. Intermec recommends a value of 140 for darker areas. You should set this to the lowest possible value that still results in good quality images.

member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on Imager methods and properties.
Throws exception with invalid input value.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.IllumLevel
member.summary: Adjusts brightness as a ratio of available lighting from imager LEDS. On some devices value range is 0 - 15, on others 0 - 100.

remarks.para: It sets the maximum brightness level of the illumination LEDs that can be used to achieve the .

The valid range depends on the imager installed in your Intermec computer:
Imager IllumLevel Range Default
EA11, EA11D, EA11-HD 0 to 100 100 (brightest setting)
EA20X 0 to 15 15 (brightest setting)
EA21 (decoded) 0 to 100 100 (brightest setting)
EA21U 0 to 15 15 (brightest setting)
EX25 0 to 100 100 (brightest setting)
remarks.note: Set the illumination level on a lower setting when reading shiny bar code labels where high intensity lighting will be too bright to decode the label.

member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on Imager methods and properties.
Throws exception with invalid input value.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.AimerFlashing
member.summary: Controls the aimer flash during image acquisition.
member.remarks: The aimer which is used to aim at the bar code you want to read can be on all the time or flashing. When using aimer flashing mode the aimer beam flashes so that you can position the aimer on the bar code and then turns off to read the bar code. This ensure the least amount of interference from the light of the aimer beam and optimizes decoding

member.summary: Imager settings are optimized for image capture (default).
